prompt: <description>**Part 1: Construct a Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism** Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and sides that are parallel. The top and bottom faces of the prism are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the sides are equal, and the height of the prism is half the length of the sides. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0167, 0.0] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system created in step 1. 3. The sketch should have a single face (face\\_1) with a loop (loop\\_1) containing four lines. 4. Each line should have the following start and end points: * Line 1: [0.0, 0.0], [0.588, 0.0] * Line 2: [0.588, 0.0], [0.588, 0.75] * Line 3: [0.588, 0.75], [0.0, 0.75] * Line 4: [0.0, 0.75], [0.0, 0.0] 5. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.75. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following Euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0167, 0.0] 7. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0.0167 and the opposite normal to 0. **Part 2: Construct a Thin Vertical Cylinder** Construct a simple, thin, vertical cylinder with a flat top and bottom. 1. Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.588, 0.0, 0.3611] 2. Draw a 2D sketch on the X-Z plane of the coordinate system created in step 1. 3. The sketch should have a single face (face\\_1) with a loop (loop\\_1) containing four lines. 4. Each line should have the following start and end points: * Line 1: [0.0, 0.0], [0.0167, 0.0] * Line 2: [0.0167, 0.0], [0.0167, 0.0278] * Line 3: [0.0167, 0.0278], [0.0, 0.0278] * Line 4: [0.0, 0.0278], [0.0, 0.0] 5. Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling parameter of 0.0278. 6. Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the following Euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [-90.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.588, 0.0, 0.3611] 7. Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model. Set the extrusion depth towards the normal to 0 and the opposite normal to 0.5769. This will result in a cut feature operation.</description>
